items.prompt: I’m too tired. I want ____ (go) home.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using would like / would prefer.

items.prompt: I want to sit near the window. -> I ____ near the window.
We want to leave now. -> We ____ now.
She wants to talk to you. -> She ____ to you.
I prefer to stay here. -> I ____ here.
They want to see the museum. -> They ____ the museum.
I want to ask a question. -> I ____ a question.
He prefers to work alone. -> He ____ alone.
She hopes ____ a new job soon.
Do you know ____ to the station?
We don’t know ____ with this form.
I don’t feel like ____ (go) out tonight.
I’m not used to ____ (get) up early.
He walked past without ____ (look) at me.
Do you expect me ____ (pay) for it?
I’d like you ____ (send) me the link.
They let us ____ the room early.
Nothing can make him ____ his mind.
They made us ____ for an hour.
The doctor advised me ____ more water.
I stopped ____ because it was unhealthy.
On the way home, I stopped ____ a coffee.
Remember ____ the door when you leave.
I remember ____ that song when I was a child.
I tried ____ him, but he didn’t answer.
If the app is slow, try ____ your phone.
I’ll never forget ____ you for the first time.

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct form (-ing or to + verb).

items.prompt: He stopped ____ (talk) and looked at me.
We stopped ____ (buy) water on the way.
I’ll always remember ____ (see) the ocean for the first time.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite to show the difference in meaning.

items.prompt: I stopped because I wanted to smoke. -> I stopped ____ .
I stopped the habit of smoking. -> I stopped ____ .
I didn’t forget; I did it. -> I remembered ____ .
I have a memory of it. -> I remember ____ .
I made an effort but failed. -> I tried ____ .
I tested it as a method. -> I tried ____ .
I have a clear memory. -> I remember ____ clearly.
I went to the shop ____ (buy) bread.
He opened the window ____ (get) some air.

exercises.instruction: Complete with in order (not) to / so as (not) to.

items.prompt: I turned down the music ____ not ____ (disturb) anyone.
He wore gloves ____ (keep) his hands warm.
I wrote it down ____ not ____ (forget) it.
We took a taxi ____ (arrive) on time.
I need a knife ____ cut bread.
I need a knife ____ cutting bread.
I went out ____ some fresh air.
He left early ____ catch the train.
She studied hard ____ pass the exam.
It’s dangerous ____ at night without lights.
Meeting you is nice. -> It’s nice ____ .
Driving fast is dangerous. -> It’s dangerous ____ .
Finding a hotel was hard. -> It was hard ____ .
Arguing was silly. -> It was silly ____ .
See you again is great. -> It’s great ____ .
Understand this is difficult. -> It’s difficult ____ .
Wait here is easy. -> It’s easy ____ .
Park here is impossible. -> It’s impossible ____ .
You can learn a lot by ____ (listen).
She walked past without ____ (look) at me.
Instead of ____ (drive), we took a bus.
I’m not very good at ____ (remember) names.
You can improve by ____ every day.
She isn’t used to ____ in snow.
The best thing is ____ (see) friends again.
My main aim is ____ (improve) my English.
One thing I enjoy is ____ new places.
It took me a month to ____ the new schedule.
I ____ live in Lviv, but now I live in Kyiv.
She isn’t used to ____ in English at work.
We’re used to ____ a lot of emails.

exercises.instruction: Complete with be used to / get used to.

items.prompt: I’m not used to ____ (work) at night.
Don’t worry. You’ll get used to ____ (drive) on the left.
It took him ages to get used to ____ (wear) glasses.
I’m getting used to ____ (my new phone).
We aren’t used to ____ (so much traffic).
He got used to ____ (speak) in public.
In the past, I lived in a small village. -> I ____ in a small village.
She was afraid of dogs before. -> She ____ afraid of dogs.
We played football every day. -> We ____ football every day.
He didn’t drink coffee before. -> He ____ coffee.
I went to bed late in those days. -> I ____ to bed late.
They didn’t have a car then. -> They ____ a car.
She often travelled for work. -> She ____ for work.
I never liked cheese before. -> I ____ cheese.

exercises.instruction: Complete with prefer (to / -ing) and would rather.

items.prompt: I ____ (prefer) ____ (walk) to work when it’s sunny.
Would you rather ____ (have) tea or coffee?
I prefer ____ at home on Sundays.
Would you rather ____ here or outside?

exercises.instruction: Rewrite using would rather + past (someone else).

items.prompt: Please don’t smoke here. -> I’d rather you ____ here.
Please come a bit earlier. -> I’d rather you ____ earlier.
Please don’t tell anyone. -> I’d rather you ____ anyone.
Please didn’t drive so fast. -> I’d rather you ____ so fast.
Please stayed for dinner. -> I’d rather you ____ for dinner.
Please didn’t call me late. -> I’d rather you ____ me late.
Please helped me with this. -> I’d rather you ____ me with this.
Please didn’t be late. -> I’d rather you ____ late.
